channel.title: Ultimate Scripting/SCAR Guide/Tutorial
channel.description:
[b]Orginally posted at Kaitnieks - Posting it here to because of high demands.. :P[/b]
[B]INTRODUCTION[/B] In this guide, you will learn alot of stuff, from moving the mouse and clicking somewhere, finding a bitmap, and making simple scripts.
In this guide, you will also learn to fix your own errors, make your code cleaner and learn some tips and tricks to make your scripts better.
If you find any problems or wish to have something added here please PM me then.
Good luck and enjoy!
[B]CHAPTERS[/B]
[ul][u][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7069.msg72231.html#msg72231]>> POST 1[/url][/u] [*]Script information [*]Commenting [*]Clean code [*]Using the color picker [u][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7069.msg72243.html#msg72243]>> POST 2[/url][/u] [*]Variables [*]Bitmaps [*]Begin ... Repeat [*]Includes [u][url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,7069.msg72256.html#msg72256]>> POST 3[/url][/u] [*]Functions and their usage [*]Errors/problems + FAQ [*]Script samples [*]Other Stuff[/ul]
[br][br][hr]
[B]SCRIPT INFORMATION[/B] At first, when starting a new script. You can always put some comments on the top, which most of the people do, with the script version, author, information etc. Which may look at this:
[code] // --> Ultimate Power Auto Miner // --> Version 1.0 // --> Created by: Nickname // --> Release date: 2005 1 September // --> Set up the setup at line 50 to 62 // --> Start at Falador Iron rocks, with a pickaxe. [/code]
[img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/7898/exampleuf9.png[/img] [i]Picture example.[/i]
You can try doing something like that, yourself, manually, or use the one already inbuilt SCAR:
Script -> Script properties and fill in those you like.[br][br][hr]
[B]COMMENTING[/B] It's very important, to always comment the code. Sure, some people may think it's useless. No one is forcing you either to do it, but it is good. You can see what a certain line of a code does, or what a procedure do, so if you may forget it one day, or if you have a script with around 500 lines or less or more, large scripts. It may be hard to control it all, therefore, commenting comes handy. Here is a small example of commenting:
[code] // Click the banker, and then move the mouse to chat. procedure click; begin ClickMouse(252, 252, True) wait(3000) MoveMouse(526, 262); end; [/code] You can even comment the lines if you want.
Comments dosen't get compiled.[br][br][hr]
[B]CLEAN CODE[/B] It's very also important, to have a clean code, with spaces, using the scripting standards. Just plain nice code. It makes it easier for yourself to code, understand and maintain your code much better, and the one that uses your script won't stop using it just because it looks ugly. The design matters alot for some people, the code have to be nice, clean, and using the scripting standards.
[U]Example at bad code:[/U] [code] procedure blah; begin clickmouse(525,252,true) wait(2000) if (fish='1')then Writeln('bad script'); end; [/code]
[U]Example at good code:[/U] [code] procedure Blah; begin Clickmouse(525, 252, True); Wait(2000); if (fish='1')then Writeln('good script'); end; [/code]
[br][br][hr]
[B] USING THE COLOR PICKER [/B] In this chapter, I will teach you how you can use the color picker, It's a very useful tool. It's all about using it the right way. Using the color picker, you can get coordinates and color of something..
The Debug box aka Large white box: [img]http://img111.imageshack.us/img111/4832/debugbozwa3.png[/img]
You click on the color picker, then let's say you click on it something red colored. When you have done that, in SCAR, in the bottom. In the degub box (Look at pic above) something like this will show up:
[code] Color Picked: 8083520 at (14, 509) [/code] The [B]8083520[/B] is the color of something you have picked, using the color picker and the [B](14, 509)[/B] is the coordinates of that "area" you picked the color at. You can use them both. Here is a small example:
[U] USING THE COLOR [/U] [code] // This code will, search for the color 8083520 in the coordinates/area 100, 255, 255 100. And then click on the "color" which is ClickMouse(x, y, True) procedure colorfinder; begin If (FindColor(x, y, 8083520, 100, 255, 255, 100))then ClickMouse(x, y, True) end; [/code]
[U] USING THE COORDINATES [/U] [code] // This code will click with the mouse on the coordinates 14, 509, picked with the color picker. Notice how we removed those to parantes? It used to be (14, 509) we removed the two ( ) and we used the 14, 509 only procedure clickcoord; begin ClickMouse(14, 509, True); end; [/code] [B]Please note that these code samples are not the full code, you need to add a few other stuff which will be explained later on.[/B]
This code is full code; [code] program MoveandClick;
var x,y:integer;
procedure blah; begin if (findcolor(x,y,16765852,0,0,84,118)) then ClickMouse(x, y, True); end;
begin repeat blah; until(false) end. [/code] If you want to know, how to get the four last coordinates (0, 0, 0, 0) then click [URL=http://-]here[/URL]. (link broken, gotta fix) [I]If you don't understand this, post a reply and I will write one.[/I]
The Color picker: [img]http://img100.imageshack.us/img100/8817/coloprickerwr5.png[/img]
[br][br][hr]

item.title: Ultimate Scripting/SCAR Guide/Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:15, topic:5360”]no no no, this is how you do it.

Procedure Blah;
Begin
  ClickMouse(525, 252, True);
  Wait(2000);
  If (fish='1') Then 
    WriteLn('A good script.');
End;

:)[/quote]
Ron, don’t capitalize the bold. That’s what Kaitnieks use to say, ‘uneeded and ugly’.

Thanks Xerxes, I remember when I was extremely noob I read this, and was able to make my first script. (:

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate Scripting/SCAR Guide/Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

[quote=“Xerxes, post:19, topic:5360”]…and those xs thingy I forgot my self how to do it :|.[/quote] Muhaha

Easy… You just make yourself, or with color picker ‘‘invisible’’ boxes where SCAR will click, or detect colors from. I am sure you have been using it alot.

 ys

xs ±---------+
| |
| Square |
| |
| |
±---------+ xe
ye

That is an example made by Cheesehunk in other thread =)

Read full topic
